meanings.definition: Relating to or causing the breakdown of red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The hemolytic reaction in the body led to the destruction of red blood cells.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the hemolytic condition was causing the red blood cells to break down.
meanings.sent3: The hemolytic effect of the medication was so strong that it made the red blood cells disappear like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a hemolytic force, destroying any sense of peace in the room.
meanings.sent5: The hemolytic nature of the disease made the red blood cells burst like tiny balloons.

meanings.definition: A substance or process that causes the destruction of red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The hemolytic was identified as the cause of the red blood cell destruction.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied the hemolytic to understand its impact on red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The hemolytic seemed to have a mischievous personality, gleefully destroying red blood cells.
meanings.sent4: The hemolytic acted like a silent assassin, targeting only the red blood cells.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the hemolytic was like a ticking time bomb for the red blood cells.
